alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:34PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 515 PM MDT... At 434 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buffalo, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake De Smet and Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 295 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 42 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for north central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
